key_points: DarkSide hackers breached Colonial Pipeline's cyber defenses, causing widespread panic and fuel shortages.
Colonial Pipeline resumed operations after reportedly paying a $5 million ransom in bitcoin.
KKR acquired a 23.4% stake in Colonial Pipeline in 2010, highlighting private equity's interest in infrastructure.
The energy sector has seen a decrease in private equity investments, but midstream companies remain attractive due to predictable cash flow.
KKR has been active in pipeline investments, including forming a joint venture with Williams and acquiring stakes in various midstream projects.
KKR is raising capital for a new infrastructure fund, targeting $12 billion.
Global demand for oil is expected to continue growing into the 2030s, ensuring ongoing investments in oil and gas pipelines.
Ransomware attacks like the one on Colonial Pipeline are becoming increasingly frequent, with significant financial impacts.
KKR led a $90 million investment in cybersecurity company NetSPI following the Colonial attack.
Ginkgo Bioworks announced one of the biggest SPAC deals ever, with a $17.5 billion post-money valuation.
